gameplay.2213: Sometimes the threat of an ability is more dangerous than the usage of the ability.
gameplay.2006: The monsters in the jungle won't hurt you unless you attack them.
gameplay.2315: You can watch your own Minions on the minimap to figure out where your opponent's Minions are.
gameplay.2203: You can look at a Tower's item inventory to see many kinds of special effects that Towers have.
gameplay.2003: Brush, the grassy areas around Summoner's Rift, hides you from enemies.
gameplay.2219: Sharing experience in a lane gives your team more total experience than a single champion would get.
gameplay.2209: Tower icons on the minimap become empty as their towers become damaged.
gameplay.2004: You gain the benefits of items right when you buy them. No need to equip!
gameplay.2005: When you are ready to type to your teammates, you can enable chat in the options menu!
gameplay.2101: In the Options menu, you can assign a keybind to make your champion stop attacking.
gameplay.2121: Be careful when fighting Voidgrubs. Killing one restores health to the others!
gameplay.2327: Baron Nashor takes reduced damage from whoever he is attacking.
gameplay.2218: Mosstompers love to snack on honeyfruit.
gameplay.2205: Towers deal increasingly more damage with each hit.
gameplay.2306: Gustwalkers use scryer's blooms to scout for predators.
gameplay.2303: Attacking a ward always reveals you to the enemy team, even if it's disabled.
gameplay.2309: There is a pizza on Summoner's Rift, can you find it?
gameplay.2304: If you Flash into a wall, you will appear at the nearest location. Use this to gain extra distance.
gameplay.2323: Many objects created by champions can be Teleported to. This includes Thresh's lantern, Jarvan's flag, or even Zac's exploded blobs.
gameplay.2326: Item haste reduces both active and passive cooldowns of items you have.
gameplay.2108: Enemy Minions will turn to attack you if you attack a champion near them.
gameplay.2220: Elder Dragon can only spawn once a team has killed four dragons and gotten the Dragon Soul.
gameplay.2206: The green dot on your teammates' portraits shows when their ultimate abilities are ready!
gameplay.2113: If you land the last hit that kills a Minion or jungle monster, you earn the gold for that kill.
gameplay.2316: Leaving a few enemy Minions alive in a lane will cause your Minions to slowly push forward without you needing to be there.
gameplay.2300: As long as you haven't left fountain or used abilities, you can re-open the shop and undo purchases.
gameplay.2307: While there's no Dragon present, you can see which kind of Dragon will arrive next by looking at the symbol in its pit.
gameplay.2211: Recall won't be cancelled if you are interrupted in the last 0.1 seconds of its channel.
gameplay.2007: It takes 18360 experience to get to level 18.
gameplay.2321: Baron Nashor does much more damage to those behind him.
gameplay.2311: Most wards only last for a limited time. You can click on them to view their remaining duration.
gameplay.2302: In the wild, scorchclaws use blastcones to navigate treacherous lavafields.
gameplay.2204: The Dragon respawns 5 minutes after its death.
gameplay.2217: The littlest, shiniest krugs hold most of the gold.
gameplay.2103: There are three possible Baron Nashor pits that can spawn.
gameplay.2201: Killing 3 waves of Minions is worth more gold than killing 1 champion at the game's start. Minions are worth even more later!
gameplay.2214: If multiple equipped items share a passive with the same name, the effect will apply only once.
gameplay.2318: There are health bar indicators for having a revive, spellshield, and more!
gameplay.2102: You can buy items while dead.
gameplay.2221: If a team kills four dragons they're rewarded with the Dragon Soul, a powerful permanent buff.
gameplay.2001: Your champion will continue attacking after only a single click.
gameplay.2104: The Elder Dragon spawns after one team kills 4 dragons. Slaying it grants your team great power!
gameplay.2314: You can place Wards and drink Potions while channeling a spell, such as Recall.
gameplay.2008: Gold can be spent to purchase items to make you MUCH more powerful.
gameplay.2002: Pressing @k1@ opens and closes the Item Shop.
gameplay.2110: At Level 9, you unlock an additional trinket option. You can change your trinket for free in the Item Shop!
gameplay.2324: The stats gained from a champion level is usually worth more gold than the gold from a champion kill.
gameplay.2310: The more Dragons your team has slain, the more powerful they become against you!
gameplay.2325: Champions have a larger vision range than wards.
gameplay.2208: Champions with empowered autoattacks, like Jax, can reset their autoattacks with said abilities.
gameplay.2216: After you summon Rift Herald to fight for your team, you can hop in to direct her where you want to go!
gameplay.2119: Each section of a champion's health bar represents 100 HP.
gameplay.2210: Slaying Baron Nashor grants your team a lot of gold and a significantly faster recall that lets you get back and upgrade your items quickly.
gameplay.2118: Minions that spawn together are commonly referred to as a ''wave.''
gameplay.2106: If you hold down Ctrl or Alt, you can click and drag with your mouse to access a menu of special pings.
gameplay.2301: Honeyfruit can spawn all across the river. Keep an eye out!
gameplay.2317: While you have the scoreboard open, clicking the monster timers in the top communicates them to your teammates. No need to press Alt.
gameplay.2322: Attacking an enemy while you're inside brush will reveal you.
gameplay.2212: If you leave base without a trinket, you will automatically receive a Stealth Ward.
gameplay.2107: Individually, Minions don't do a lot of damage. But in a group, their attacks can really add up!
gameplay.2200: You can right click to both buy and sell items.
gameplay.2111: Some champions can use abilities to move over walls, allowing them to attack or escape unexpectedly.
gameplay.2109: A few abilities, like Garen's Decisive Strike, can damage structures.
gameplay.2112: The colors in your ability tooltips can give you hints, such as which item stats make that ability stronger.
gameplay.2115: You can hold down Alt to cast an ability on yourself.
gameplay.2312: It takes just over 30 seconds for a Minion to reach the center of Top Lane from when it spawns. It takes just over 20 seconds for Mid Lane.
gameplay.2319: League of Legends changes frequently. Make sure to read your tooltips regularly to keep up to date!
gameplay.2202: The Item Shop can be resized by dragging its bottom right corner.
gameplay.2308: Neutral monsters attack whatever is closest to them.
gameplay.2305: You can cast Flash during the cast time of some abilities, letting you surprise your opponents.
gameplay.2320: Champions are most vulnerable to attack when they are in the middle of an action, like attacking a Minion.
gameplay.2114: Ability Power increases the overall effectiveness of many abilities, not just damage.
gameplay.2117: Unlike most channeled spells, Recall can be interrupted by damage. This can be used to disrupt your opponent's plans!
gameplay.2313: Destroyed Wards leave behind debris. The brighter they are, the more recently they expired.
gameplay.2215: Killing Voidgrubs grants stacks of Hunger for the Void. At 4 stacks your attacks against structures summon Voidmites to attack your target!
gameplay.2207: Invisible champions' silhouettes can be revealed with the Oracle Lens trinket.
gameplay.2116: You can quickly level-up an ability by holding Ctrl and pressing the ability's hotkey.
gameplay.2100: While there are no enemy Minions nearby, Towers take significantly reduced damage.
gameplay.2120: The map transforms after two dragons are slain. After transforming, only dragons of that map type can spawn.
gameplay.2105: Using Wards will let you see where you're not, even in bushes!

narrative.1061: Dr. Mundo isn't actually a doctor. He just thinks he is.
narrative.1043: In Shurima, those who survived a failed Ascension ritual are known as the Baccai, who are often twisted and malformed.
narrative.11017: ''No matter how the world tries to break you. Protect the family.'' - Vander
narrative.1143: Varus is a Darkin, reborn in the combined flesh of two Ionian hunters, Valmar and Kai.
narrative.1166: The Monolith, a massive structure of living rock, was built thousands of years ago to fight the Void. Malphite is all that remains of the Monolith, but his duty is unchanged.
narrative.1177: The grieving king Viego tried to bring his dead queen back to life in the magical waters of the Blessed Isles. He failed, giving rise to the Ruination.
narrative.1055: Blitzcrank was created by Viktor, and eventually became stronger, faster, and smarter than any golem or automaton.
narrative.11009: ''This is the city of progress. Think of the wonders we could create.'' - Jayce
narrative.1153: The Aspect of Twilight gave mortals the knowledge to trap Aatrox and the other Darkin.
narrative.1149: Zed was a member of the Kinkou, before he left and formed his Order of Shadow.
narrative.1022: Before the Ruination, the Shadow Isles were known as the Blessed Isles.
narrative.1078: The callers of the Serpent Isles sound enormous horns carved into the cliffs to beckon forth great sea monsters.
narrative.11047: ''Between Stillwater Hold and The Dredge, Piltover has a spot ready for the worst the Undercity throws at them.''
narrative.1106: Kassadin's name originates from the Shuriman phrase, ''Kas sai a dyn?'' or ''Whom does the desert know?''
narrative.1098: Some say yordles know secret ways through Runeterra that others cannot perceive.
narrative.1173: Ordinary citizens have no idea that the Sentinels of Light patrol Runeterra with ancient relic weapons, keeping them safe from the Shadow Isles' wraiths.
narrative.11003: ''I want hextech to be a tool for us to build a better world.'' - Jayce
narrative.1113: Pyke made his name as a harpooner in Bloodharbor, a district of slaughter docks in Bilgewater.
narrative.1041: Some Shuriman nomads have created entire towns upon the backs of the dormun - enormous beasts that wander the desert.
narrative.11059: ''The Piltover Enforcers have reached a tentative truce with the citizens of the Lanes.''
narrative.1104: According to legend, True Ice never melts. However, elemental magic or the power bestowed by demi-gods may test that truth...
narrative.1131: Riven begged an Ionian elder, Souma, to destroy her blade. In doing so, she inadvertently caused his death.
narrative.1037: The Blessed Isles were home to a society of scholars, who gathered magical artifacts and historical records from across Runeterra.
narrative.1142: A former Noxian headsman, Urgot was betrayed and imprisoned in the Dredge, a mine deep beneath Zaun.
narrative.1150: Kayn's master is Zed, who believes the young man could one day lead the Order of Shadow.
narrative.1147: The Spirit Blossom festival is a holiday in Ionia when the living honor and commune with their deceased loved ones.
narrative.1016: Many frost trolls have rallied behind their self proclaimed king, Trundle.
narrative.1164: As a child, Rell was subject to brutal experimentation. Thanks to her iron will, her instructors didn't survive.
narrative.1040: Deep beneath Shurima's ancient capital lies the Oasis of the Dawn, believed by many to be the source of all rivers in the land.
narrative.1172: The monstrous Darkin were once noble warriors of the Shuriman Empire.
narrative.1058: The Tidecaller's staff allows its wielder to command water, and is drawn to the power of the moon.
narrative.1160: Though the undercity of Zaun falls under the jurisdiction of the Enforcers, the chembarons and their gangs are not particularly interested in being ruled by distant topsiders.
narrative.11014: ''They won't stop. We need to fight back. And if you won't, I will.'' - Vi
narrative.1006: The God-Willow was an ancient tree found in Ionia, which was felled by Ivern the Cruel.
narrative.11004: ''This technology? It's real. And no matter what happens here, it's going to change our world.'' - Jayce
narrative.11005: ''The boy's got ambition. It's why we supported him in the first place.'' - Councilor Kiramman
narrative.1017: Artifacts of True Ice hold incredible power, but only the Iceborn can wield them.
narrative.1134: Samira's tattoos tell the story of her most daring missions. If you ask her, she'll say she still has space for more.
narrative.1118: Evelynn is a demon who thrives on the pain of her victims.
narrative.1072: Caitlyn's rifle is unique among the Enforcers, outfitted with the very best of hextech. Being childhood friends with Jayce Talis has its advantages.
narrative.1095: Sivir's crossblade, the Chalicar, once belonged to Setaka, an Ascended god-warrior of Shurima.
narrative.1100: Located far from civilization, Mount Targon is utterly remote, reachable only by the most determined seeker.
narrative.1010: Legends tell of another realm beyond Mount Targon's peak, inhabited by great celestial beings.
narrative.1039: Gnar was frozen in True Ice for a long, long time.
narrative.1148: Yorick wears the Tears of Life, a vial of water drawn from the Blessed Isles' sacred springs.
narrative.1081: The brothers Darius and Draven grew up as orphans in the port city of Basilich.
narrative.1046: There is a garden in southern Ionia where flowers consume memories.
narrative.11046: ''Chef Jericho is known for exquisite stall-cooked meals, found only in the Undercity, of course.''
narrative.11034: ''You can purchase a Krug in Zaun, but they don't exactly make great pets.''
narrative.1120: Gnar's boomerang is actually the jawbone of a drüvask, a type of boar native to the Freljord.
narrative.11039: ''Looking for a job? Little Man may have caught wind of a promising haul in Piltover for you.''
narrative.1005: Many of the Voidborn have names derived from the ancient Shuriman language.
narrative.11045: ''Powder wasn't the only artist in her group of friends. Mylo was seen tagging rooftops from time to time.''
narrative.1155: Demacians play a variant of Tellstones called “King's Gambit”, in honor of Santon the Great.
narrative.1151: Zilean is a survivor of Icathia's destruction by the Void.
narrative.1027: Drakehounds, a distant relative of dragons, are kept by some rich, and perhaps foolish, Noxians as pets.
narrative.1085: Hextech is the fusion of magic and technology, harnessing the power contained within extremely rare crystals.
narrative.11049: ''Rumor has spread throughout the Undercity that Piltover's Chief Enforcer passed under mysterious circumstances.''
narrative.1080: Nunu's yeti companion is named Willump. Willump's human companion is named Nunu.
narrative.1126: Lee Sin and Udyr fought side by side against the Noxian invasion of Ionia.
narrative.1159: Don't tell Sett's mom what he does for a living. We wouldn't want her to worry, right?
narrative.1045: The myths of the Spirit Blossom festival serve as both tales of history and moral lessons.
narrative.1116: Bard has been known by many names, including the Cosmic Vagabond and the Great Caretaker.
narrative.1015: Like the ancient Shurimans that once inhabited their land, modern-day Zaunites revere Janna— or Jan'ahrem— as a goddess, said to protect her followers from furious tempests.
narrative.1108: Nunu and his mother, Layka, were members of the Notai, a nomadic Freljordian tribe that worshipped Anivia.
narrative.1132: Ryze was Kegan Rodhe's master, before Kegan became Brand.
narrative.1049: In life, Hecarim led the Iron Order, an infamous brotherhood of mounted knights.
narrative.11015: ''I grew up knowing I'm less than them. That my place is down there.'' - Vi
narrative.1024: To stave off a great danger beneath the ocean, the Marai illuminate the depths with a moonstone.
narrative.1083: When the wharf rats of Bilgewater gather in great swarms, they can devour an adult human in minutes.
narrative.1171: The lush jungles of Ixtal border the Shuriman desert, yet few Shurimans know that a thriving civilization still dwells in the heart of that wilderness.
narrative.1165: Deep in Shurima, the sand itself flows like water. Perhaps it is this constant shifting that keeps Brand, the vengeful fire mage, trapped beneath its dunes.
narrative.11063: With some help from Powder, Vander installed a panic button in The Last Drop. If only they'd never had to use it...
narrative.11001: ''I believe I've discovered something truly incredible… A way to harness magic through science!'' - Jayce
narrative.11055: ''Councilor Irius Bolbok distrusts the arcane with every gear and bolt of his being.''
narrative.1167: The northern coast of Shurima is partially controlled by Noxus, though the rebirth of Shurima's Emperor Azir may bring that to an end.
narrative.1074: Taric, a former Demacian soldier, is host to the Targonian Aspect of the Protector.
narrative.1163: A disastrous attempt to cut a canal through Piltover led to the city's partial collapse - and the creation of Zaun.
narrative.1076: When Orianna succumbed to poisonous fumes, her father replaced her failing organs with mechanical augments, turning her into a lady of clockwork.
narrative.1030: Native to northern Demacia are the rare, ferocious raptors. Only a few talented individuals are able to tame and ride these beasts.
narrative.1092: In Bilgewater, the dead are not always buried - they are often given back to the ocean in submerged caskets below bobbing tombstones.
narrative.11058: ''Vander keeps his worn gauntlets as a constant reminder...and a promise.''
narrative.1111: The Demacian capital, and seat of the monarchy, is the Great City of Demacia.
narrative.11022: ''If you really want people to talk to you, you have to let them think you have what they want.'' - Vi
narrative.1112: Brand spent his childhood in the outlying Freljordian settlement of Rygann's Reach.
narrative.1033: Zaun's wealthiest can often be found on the city's Promenade levels, which intersect with Piltover's lowest regions.
narrative.1156: Despite the game's popularity across Runeterra, no one seems to know where Tellstones originated...
narrative.1071: The Ecliptic Vaults were once considered to be Piltover's most secure bank, before Jinx breached its heavily reinforced walls.
narrative.11020: ''I'm a misfit too, I suppose.'' - Caitlyn
narrative.1144: Vel'Koz's name translates roughly in the ancient Shuriman language as ''to understand by unmaking.''
narrative.1170: One of the largest deserts in Shurima is known as the Great Sai. It is home to a number of raider tribes, including those who killed Sivir's family.
narrative.11018: ''Throws herself at trouble wherever she can find some.'' - Vander
narrative.1138: Katarina, Cassiopeia, and Talon are all members of the Noxian noble House Du Couteau.
narrative.1053: Rumble's mech is named Tristy, in honor of a yordle who is very important to him.
narrative.1020: Time flows strangely in Bandle City, making yordles seem almost ageless to outsiders.
narrative.1048: Khada Jhin is a stage name. Jhin's true identity remains a mystery.
narrative.11042: ''That band playing at the Last Drop sounds oddly familiar. Believable Serpents? No that's not right. ''
narrative.1135: Singed's chemical weapons were used by Noxus in their invasion of Ionia.
narrative.1013: Garen and Lux are members of the Crownguard family, which has protected the Demacian throne for generations.
narrative.1035: The Sump is the lowest region of Zaun. Few choose to dwell here for long.
narrative.11008: ''We're the champions of discovery. Why fear it when we can master it?'' - Jayce
narrative.1130: Nocturne once haunted the Demacian city of Fossbarrow.
narrative.11041: ''House Talis gained status by putting hammers in the hands of the people.''
narrative.1004: Sai Kahleek is one of Shurima's most feared deserts, as it is populated by the ravenous Xer'Sai.
narrative.1031: Legends speak of Avarosa, a queen of the ancient Freljord, and how she was betrayed by her own sister.
narrative.1002: One of Kled's many titles is ''High Major Commodore of the First Legion Third Multiplication Double Admiral Artillery Vanguard Company.''
narrative.11012: ''What makes you different, makes you strong.'' - Vi
narrative.11048: ''The arcane has been a part of Jayce's life since he was a child - far more so than his mother will admit.''
narrative.1141: Tryndamere became oathbound to Ashe at the sacred Avarosan site of Rakelstake.
narrative.1109: Akali's favored weapons are the kama and kunai - a handheld sickle and a throwing dagger.
narrative.1089: Ionian architecture is known for its harmonious fluidity with nature.
narrative.1174: The wraith Kalista once faithfully served the Ruined King, Viego. This loyalty cost Kalista her life.
narrative.1146: Warwick is hunting you right now.
narrative.1036: Lee Sin lost his vision when he invoked the dragon spirit, a lesson in humility he has yet to fully master.
narrative.1110: Irelia severed Swain's left arm during the Great Stand at Navori, halting the Noxian advance at the Placidium.
narrative.1011: Demacians use the fossilized bark of ancient trees to create petricite, a magic-absorbing substance with which they build their city walls.
narrative.11025: ''You know what else reflects on the council? Its citizens living on the streets.'' - Caitlyn
narrative.1152: Before she became the Aspect of Twilight, Zoe was a child of the Lunari.
narrative.1125: Kayn's full name is Shieda Kayn.
narrative.1056: Ekko is the leader of the Firelights, a band of Zaunites known for their fiery devotion to building a better future... often at the expense of Piltover property.
narrative.1079: Twisted Fate was born to the nomadic river-folk of the Serpentine, a river flowing near Bilgewater.
narrative.11002: ''A little danger is worth the risk, dontcha think?'' - Jayce
narrative.11043: ''Alarms are mounted to the roofs of Piltovan buildings just in case. Thankfully, all seems quiet right now.''
narrative.11011: ''We've all had bad days, but we learn. And we stick together.'' - Vi
narrative.11016: ''This is how things are, how they've always been. I was so stupid to think it could change.'' - Vi
narrative.11054: ''The Atlas Gauntlets were built to aide Piltovan miners move large rocks with ease''
narrative.1127: Nasus and Renekton were mortal brothers, and joined the ranks of the Ascended Host together.
narrative.1038: Lux trusted Sylas. Now Demacians are dead.
narrative.11036: ''Rumor has it a monster lurks in the heart of Zaun.''
narrative.1139: Thresh's lantern is a prison for countless souls, including that of Senna, Lucian's wife—who later escaped...
narrative.1070: The people of Bilgewater deeply respect the creatures of the deep, so much so, that their currency is Golden Krakens and Silver Serpents.
narrative.1050: Using enchanted waters, Maokai turned the desolate islands of his birth into a verdant paradise.
narrative.11050: ''Most folks take the Bathysphere through layers of the Undercity. The locals have...other methods.''
narrative.1103: Bilgewater's boom-and-bust economy is based almost entirely on the hunting and harvesting of sea monsters.
narrative.1019: Trundle's True Ice club is named Boneshiver.
narrative.1065: Rengar is one of the Kiilash, a vastayan tribe from Shurima.
narrative.1026: Basilisks of the jungle are sometimes raised from the egg as Noxian war beasts.
narrative.1068: Wukong's vastayan tribe, the Shimon, dwells among the canopies of Ionia's tallest trees.
narrative.1176: Viego hails from the distant land of Camavor. In his thousand-year absence, his kingdom has fallen, forgotten.
narrative.1094: The Frozen Watchers are believed to be trapped in the Howling Abyss.
narrative.11032: ''Family sticks together! You said it yourself.'' - Powder
narrative.1157: The Dauntless Vanguard play their own version of Tellstones, and use it to settle disputes within the ranks.
narrative.1018: While attempting to tame the ancient Freljord with her two sisters, Lissandra was permanently blinded by the claws of the demi-god Volibear.
narrative.11038: ''Gears, bolts, screws, metal scraps: these are but a few of the things Zaunite children steal from Piltover to turn a profit.''
narrative.1129: Anivia, Ornn, Haestryr, and Volibear are among the countless demi-gods of the ancient Freljord.
narrative.11056: ''The Sump is home to creatures both beautiful and strange, though few will ever see them...or live to speak of the encounter.''
narrative.11023: ''Caitlyn Kiramman. Why does that not surprise me? Interfering in an investigation? Again?'' - Marcus
narrative.1088: Years of polluting the atmosphere with chemical fumes caused a near-permanent blanket of noxious vapor to fester in Zaun. At its lowest levels, "the Gray" can be, at times, fatal to breathe.
narrative.1154: King Santon of Demacia avoided civil war with a game of Tellstones, saving thousands of lives.
narrative.1042: The Gatekeeper. The Fox. The Khumaia. All are names for the same spirit celebrated during the Spirit Blossom festival.
narrative.11044: ''Jinx's weapons are also her closest friends. Not exactly what we'd call healthy relationships.''
narrative.11010: ''One day, this city's gonna respect us.'' - Vi
narrative.1077: Vi wields a pair of gauntlets imbued with hextech power. They were crafted by Jayce Talis, their original purpose to handle superheated objects.
narrative.1119: Ezreal discovered his gauntlet inside the lost tomb of Ne'Zuk, in Shurima.
narrative.1128: Olaf hails from the Freljordian peninsula of Lokfar.
narrative.1122: Heimerdinger and Ziggs used to operate a pyrotechnics shop in Piltover.
narrative.1087: Zaun's powerful chem-barons keep a loose alliance that prevents the city from descending into chaos.
narrative.1133: Sejuani's drüvask boar is named Bristle.
narrative.11027: ''I'm a helpless little girl, and I set the building on fire by accident. Totally by accident.'' - Jinx
narrative.1168: The hunting grounds of Rek'Sai, littered with the remains of thousands of her victims, are sometimes called the "Bone Sea"
narrative.1099: The Bearded Lady, and Mother Serpent, are both names for the Bilgewater deity Nagakabouros.
narrative.11031: ''It's Jinx now. Powder fell down a well.'' - Jinx
narrative.1114: Annie lost her mother at a very young age. Her father, sister, and stepmother all died some years later.
narrative.1101: Those Ascended by the Sun Disc of Shurima can live for thousands of years.
narrative.11035: ''Piltover's hextech innovations earned the attention of some notable Noxians.''
narrative.1145: Once a Zaunite gangster, Warwick became a monster after being transmuted by Singed.
narrative.1012: Yasuo and Yone both studied at the same school of swordcraft. It was this training that the brothers called upon in their fight to the death.
narrative.1034: The Entresol levels of Zaun are where most of the city's trade and business occur.
narrative.1082: Tahm Kench is but one of the River King's many names. Some others may be better left unsaid.
narrative.11007: ''I know it sounds impossible, but when have we ever let that stop us.'' - Jayce
narrative.1096: Nunu lost his mother when their caravan was attacked, but he holds onto hope that she's still alive. Sometimes he can hear her, singing in his dreams.
narrative.1084: Gateways of dark stone known as Noxtoraa are raised over roads in territories conquered by Noxus.
narrative.1117: Elise was once a lady of House Kythera, a powerful Noxian noble family.
narrative.1115: Sivir is a descendent of Azir, the Ascended god-emperor of Shurima.
narrative.11052: ''If not for some Undercity ruffians - and the explosion that followed - Jayce and Viktor never would have met.''
narrative.1054: Poppy was once close friends with a man named Orlon. She took up his hammer upon his death.
narrative.1044: The Solari revere the sun, and denounce all other forms of light as inferior. Their faith dominates the many cultures of Targon.
narrative.11030: ''I was saving you. I only wanted to help. I only wanted to help. I only wanted to help.'' - Powder
narrative.1162: Progress Day is a celebration in Piltover, meant to commemorate the ingenuity of invention in their fair city. In Zaun, it is a day of remembrance.
narrative.1009: Miss Fortune's pistols were crafted by her mother for the young reaver Gangplank, who then turned the guns on their creator.
narrative.1060: Jinx's rocket launcher, mini-gun, and electric pistol are named Fishbones, Pow-Pow, and Zapper.
narrative.1057: Illaoi wields ''the Eye of God,'' an idol sacred to the Buhru.
narrative.1105: Sacred to the Frostguard, Dark Ice is True Ice that has been corrupted.
narrative.11064: Caitlyn Kiramman still holds the record for fastest time on the Enforcer Shooting Range.
narrative.1047: Garen leads the Dauntless Vanguard, the kingdom of Demacia's most elite military force.
narrative.1066: Nami is one of the Marai, a vastayan tribe from the seas west of Mount Targon.
narrative.1052: Upon besting his teacher in combat, the vastaya Kong earned an honorific reserved only for the brightest of Wuju students, becoming Wukong.
narrative.11061: ''Puzzle boxes'' are handcrafted by Piltovan artisans. No two are the same, and each has a prize hidden inside.
narrative.1175: King Viego of Camavor fell in love with a seamstress, Isolde, a thousand years ago - beginning a fairytale romance that would lead to ruin.
narrative.1014: Fiora is the head of House Laurent in Demacia, a position she claimed upon killing her father in a duel.
narrative.1051: With his dying breath, Sion killed Jarvan I. The king's crown now serves as Sion's jaw.
narrative.1032: The merchant clans of Piltover preside over the city's vast trade industry... and keep much of the wealth for themselves.
narrative.1137: Taliyah was mentored by Yasuo during her time in Ionia.
narrative.1059: Thanks to her hextech heart, Camille has managed to retain some of her youthful looks despite her age.
narrative.1007: Shen became the Eye of Twilight after the death of his father, Great Master Kusho.
narrative.11013: ''Why answer to them? These are our streets.'' - Vi
narrative.11006: ''I'm close to a breakthrough, I know it.'' - Jayce
narrative.1073: Jayce's transforming hammer is powered by hextech, and owes its design to Jayce's hours toiling in the forges of his family's business.
narrative.11060: Mel's mother is an accomplished warlord and stateswoman in Noxus.
narrative.1021: The grieving king Viego tried to bring his dead queen back to life in the magical waters of the Blessed Isles. He failed, giving rise to the Ruination.
narrative.1161: Aphelios' twin sister, Alune, can only project her magical support to him when he consumes a poison that renders him mute.
narrative.11024: ''I realize you're used to getting your way, Kiramman, but we have a chain of command for a reason.'' - Marcus
narrative.1064: Quinn and her twin brother Caleb were born in the rural Demacian town of Uwendale.
narrative.11029: ''But then, there's this thing in your head, and it's raging, lighting every nerve with madness. To fight. To survive.'' - Silco
narrative.11051: ''Arcades are for more than winning prizes. Jinx learned to shoot - and Vi to punch - at one in the Undercity.''
narrative.1158: Piltovans call their home "the City of Progress." Zaunites typically use far less complimentary terms.
narrative.1028: Warmasons are tasked by Noxus not only to plot and plan infrastructure, but also to scout out enemy territory for future invasions.
narrative.11040: ''Some discoveries can be made at a desk, but not all. Jayce had to travel across Runeterra to further his hextech research.''
narrative.1067: Xayah and Rakan are vastaya, from the Lhotlan tribelands in Ionia.
narrative.1136: Soraka sees many potential futures, and has guided certain individuals to choose their own destiny.
narrative.11053: ''Caitlyn's camera is a Talis original. There's not one in Piltover quite like it!''
narrative.1063: Galio was created by a legendary Demacian sculptor named Durand.
narrative.1091: Many structures in Bilgewater are made from remains of ships gutted upon its rocky shores.
narrative.11057: ''Professor Heimerdinger's Introduction to Invention is a required course for all first years at the Academy.''
narrative.11033: ''You can discover out all sorts of secrets at The Last Drop... if you know who to ask.''
narrative.11062: Piltover is still haunted with memories from the Day of Ash, and the Enforcers have not forgotten the Undercity protestors they massacred on the Harbor Bridge.
narrative.11021: ''You're a councilor's daughter. Your actions reflect on the entire body.'' - Councilor Kiramman
narrative.1169: Ekko can rewind time. This tip used to be about Heimerdinger.
narrative.11037: ''The children of Zaun are apt at seizing every opportunity, sometimes by force.''

aprfools2019.8102: Cat Fact: No cat has ever been convicted of fraud.
aprfools2019.8113: Cat Fact: Australia was named after a cat.
aprfools2019.8109: Cat Fact: The full length of the average cat's tongue is close to four feet.
aprfools2019.8122: Dog Fact: The tallest dog in the world lives in Brussels.
aprfools2019.8126: Dog Fact: The main character of Homer's Iliad was originally a dog named 'Porky.'
aprfools2019.8117: Dog Fact: My dog ruined my favorite pillow.
aprfools2019.8116: Dog Fact: Sometimes it's okay to be sad.
aprfools2019.8125: Dog Fact: Dog saliva, when heated, becomes a powerful glue.
aprfools2019.8127: Dog Fact: Two dogs in history have earned the rank of Grand Master.
aprfools2019.8111: Cat Fact: It is physically impossible for a cat to lift a car.
aprfools2019.8128: Dog Fact: Dogs wag their tails.
aprfools2019.8110: Cat Fact: All cats are required by law to learn a musical instrument during adolescence.
aprfools2019.8108: Cat Fact: Cats can retract into their shells to avoid danger.
aprfools2019.8114: Dog Fact: It is thought that dogs have a great sense of smell. They do not.
aprfools2019.8121: Dog Fact: Dog fur is genetically identical to human teeth.
aprfools2019.8101: Cat Fact: Cats believe mirrors are weird doors.
aprfools2019.8120: Dog Fact: Dogs and sharks have a lot in common.
aprfools2019.8106: Cat Fact: Cats purr by vibrating their ears at supersonic speeds.
aprfools2019.8103: Cat Fact: A large cat can weigh as much as two smaller cats combined.
aprfools2019.8115: Dog Fact: It takes two dogs to safely operate a machine press.
aprfools2019.8107: Cat Fact: The first cat was named 'Mr. Stripes.'
aprfools2019.8119: Dog Fact: No dog has ever won an Olympic gold medal.
aprfools2019.8112: Cat Fact: Cats can only land on their feet if they've prepared a decent financial safety net.
aprfools2019.8129: Cat Fact: Cat's Eye diamonds contain very few cat eyes.
aprfools2019.8124: Dog Fact: Dog eggs can lie dormant for up to two years waiting for the right hatching conditions.
aprfools2019.8100: Cat Fact: Sometimes my cat just stands there with his mouth open like a gargoyle.
aprfools2019.8105: Cat Fact: Cat tails were used to stir cold soups in the Bronze Age.
aprfools2019.8118: Dog Fact: The Eiffel Tower is several dogs tall, at least.
aprfools2019.8123: Dog Fact: A dog's brain is located at the tip of their tail.
aprfools2019.8104: Cat Fact: Cats and humans do not have the same number of bones.

pb.4008: Is someone flaming in game? Mute unhelpful player chat or pings through the TAB menu.
pb.4006: Everyone misses a skill shot occasionally, even you.
pb.4027: When a teammate stays focused despite the odds, honor them for staying cool!
pb.4009: Even Jinx keeps cool and focuses on blowing up one thing: the enemy Nexus.
pb.4010: Games can get heated, but racial slurs have no place in League.
pb.4012: Everyone loves a killer comeback story. Don't give up!
pb.4021: Above Honor Level 3? Get honored this game and get a loading-screen flair next game.
pb.4031: It sounds dumb, but a deep breath can help prevent tilt.
pb.4011: In-game mistakes can be new opportunities. Rethink your strategy.
pb.4019: Players who work with their team unlock cool privileges, like loot!
pb.4024: Staying cool under pressure takes practice. Take a deep breath if you need one.
pb.4037: Part of being tilt-proof means getting good at expecting the unexpected!
pb.4035: If a teammate pulls the game back from the brink, honor them after the game!
pb.4015: Smart pings keep your hands where you need 'em!
pb.4034: Don't be the one to tilt your teammates and risk losing the game.
pb.4036: It's not easy to keep calm sometimes, but if you do, you're going to win more games
pb.4005: Teammate kept a cool head after a bad start? Honor them with GG <3
pb.4020: Keep focused, keep cool: you'll win more.
pb.4004: Don't let another player's frustration control your next move.
pb.4022: No team is perfect, but you're still a team. Get out there and fight to win!
pb.4032: If someone makes you uncomfortable in game, report them.
pb.4026: You can't control other's tempers, but you can keep a cool head.
pb.4018: If a player stands out, honor them after the game!
pb.4014: Use smart pings to alert your teammates to threats. You'll win more games.
pb.4017: I can't always land skill shots. I'm only human. - GorillA
pb.4003: Did a teammate help make this game great? Honor them after the game.
pb.4016: Did a teammate keep their cool, despite the odds? Honor them at end of game.
pb.4023: Support your teammates, respect the game, and level up in Honor.
pb.4028: Keep the game awesome. Report purposefully unhelpful players.
pb.4000: Competitive BSing is fine. Hate speech? Not so much.
pb.4013: You can't play a team game without a team -- don't be a leaver!
pb.4001: Life happens. We get it. But for players who keep leaving games, LeaverBuster will issue a penalty.
pb.4029: Use pings to keep your teammates informed or make suggestions.
pb.4030: Back-to-back games? Recharge with a few toe touches.
pb.4002: Did someone make some great calls? Honor them after the game.

slime.8029: The Temple of Lily and Lotus is nestled in the forested isles off the eastern coast of Qaelin.
slime.8007: The Nexus Blitz red and blue buffs are much more powerful and are granted to two champions when taken!
slime.8009: Damage dealt to inhibitor towers is reduced until both towers are destroyed.
slime.8015: Spells in URF deathmatch reset between each round so be sure to go wild.
slime.8019: The Canghapi rite of passage is said to have involved a trek from the marshes of childhood up the mountain to the temple during the rainy season.
slime.8004: Check the Nexus Blitz tab in the item shop to see items special to Nexus Blitz!
slime.8003: Jump into the Battle Sled by clicking on it. Use Recall to jump out.
slime.8026: Strips of bark from the red trees found near the temple are used to add a flavorful bitterness to dishes in eastern Ionian cuisine.
slime.8027: Though the islands are surrounded by water, the Canghapi prefered the misted air of their sacred mountain to the uniformity of the sea.
slime.8025: The beasts that live within the temple grounds seem to be the only guardians and caretakers that remain...
slime.8013: Frogs are a venerated symbol in Ionia. And we've found stone ones rarely jump off cliffs, so that's nice.
slime.8016: Legends say the Canghapi tribe were amphibious vastaya who worshipped the coming together of earth and water.
slime.8024: Some legends claim the Canghapi left their homeland because they did not trust that the Spirit of Ionia would always be able to provide balance.
slime.8017: The Canghapi settled on a mountaintop as their sacred grounds—halfway between the solid land below and the rain-soaked clouds above.
slime.8002: When the game goes on too long, both Nexuses will come to life and fight to the death!
slime.8028: Canghapi stone work was not done with hammers and chisels, but with streams of water used to slice and bore and shape the stone.
slime.8023: Inscribed on a Canghapi shrine is the saying, ''Floating blooms do not struggle once they have emerged.''
slime.8011: Experiment with different champion combinations in the jungle! Many champions are more powerful than you may expect.
slime.8018: Lilies symbolized peace and balance to the followers of the temple, while lotuses were associated with enlightenment.
slime.8014: The frog cannons at the top and bottom of Nexus Blitz can be used to more easily get to where you need.
slime.8022: Written on a Canghapi shrine is the saying, ''Rising blooms are rooted in the deep yet look to the sky.''
slime.8008: Beware the tower in the enemy jungle. It is invincible... you are not.
slime.8005: Try out new ways of travelling across the map by winning the Catapult of Champions or Battle Sled and clicking on them when they spawn in your base.
slime.8006: The Nexus Blitz Rift Herald grants the Eye of the Herald.
slime.8020: The frog sculptures that dot the landscape of the temple may have been representations of guardian spirits worshipped by the Canghapi tribe.
slime.8021: One of the frog statues appears to have a signature carved into its back...
slime.8000: It's easier to clear the Nexus Blitz jungle with two champions. You'll get extra gold and XP from monsters if you stick together!
slime.8012: Jungle guardians can never truly be destroyed and will grow back within 30 seconds.
slime.8001: Enable the sound to hear new Nexus Blitz music and gameplay cues.

arc2.narrative: While being held captive by the Black Rose, Mel learned to harness her dormant magical abilities as a powerful empath.

y1s2a2.narrative: The Burning Shade, a phantom of smoke and shadow, is said to embrace any who would let the darkness in their heart run free.

9012: Finish a round early? You can spectate the other battle by pressing the 'Spectate' button or the enemy team portait.
3302: Yuum.AI Quests require the entire team to activate!
9011: Power Flower's Flower Power is POWERFUL. For each hit, the magical pollen grants the attacker Health, Resources, Shield, and reduces cooldowns!
9028: Winterblessed Thresh likes to stand near downed players and throws his lantern to their ally.
9030: In Arena everyone starts off with an Arcane Sweeper trinket they can use to scout ahead!
9025: Normally you have to work for your money... but in Arena, you get some gold for free!
9018: Viego's wife is named Isolde. She is dead.
3306: Your weapons can evolve to become much stronger! Be sure to read their recipes.
9020: A group of poros is called a "fluft."
9027: In Arena, you'll level up alongside your opponents. No need to worry about trailing behind in XP now!
3303: An augment a day keeps the Primordians at bay! Choose wisely.
9024: Point out when your fighting partner makes an awesome play and pretend you don't see their, uh, questionable ones.
3307: You can switch between auto-aim and manual aim (default key: C).
9015: Have extra gold? Buy a Cappa Juice! It won't provide any useful buffs... but it will give you a hat!
9016: If you look in a mirror and say Jhin's name four times, nothing will happen.
9009: The shopkeeper on this map has some exclusive items marked with '!' in the shop
3304: Primordians kicking your butt? Spend gold to gain power, then try again!
9014: Strike a pose during the victory screen for S rank Style.
9026: Choncc has run a gym AND an item shop?! What's next? A hospital? A spaceport? A castle?!
9017: You can hover over the icons above the Round timer for information on upcoming rounds.
9023: Samira named her weapons Blaze, Thorn, and Vanquish.
9019: Gromp's full name is Lord Grompulous Kevin Ribbiton of Croaksworth.
9021: If you see a creepy fish-man stalking you in the shadows? You might be on Pyke's list.
3305: Matchmaking unlocks once you've completed the first difficulty on all maps.
9008: Check the oppposing team's Augment selections, use it to formulate a plan!
9029: Once per round you can revive your downed ally by standing near their body after a few seconds have past.
9022: Winterblessed Sylas will give each champion a random ultimate that they can cast once.
9013: Use the Scoreboard to see everyone's item and augment selections
9010: Champion cameos will make special appearances in some combat rounds altering the map with one of their signature abilities!

y1s1a1.narrative: Upon their death, many Noxians dream of reaching Volrachnun, a glorious afterlife for the Wolf's most devoted followers.

worlds.5050: 2014 had the longest Worlds game ever, FNC vs OMG at 1 hour 11 minutes and 34 seconds
worlds.5014: There have been 22055 assists across all World Championships
worlds.5004: Orianna is the most picked mid laner across all World Championships
worlds.5057: 2011 had the fewest games of any Worlds, at 28
worlds.5005: Thresh is the most picked support across all World Championships
worlds.5025: Since Worlds 2011, 56 teams have participated in the World Championship
worlds.5016: Sona and Thresh hold the record for most assists in a game during Worlds with 28 assists in one game
worlds.5030: SK telecom T1 won the fifth World Championship in Berlin, Germany in 2015
worlds.5001: Banned 86 times, Alistar is the most banned champion across all World Championships
worlds.5051: The pursuit of mastery is an endless journey, but those who persevere etch their names in history
worlds.5026: Fnatic won the first World Championship in Jönköping, Sweden in 2011
worlds.5023: SK telecom T1 is the only repeat World Champion with three victories
worlds.5039: Cloud holds the record for highest average assists per game of any Worlds player at 12.63
worlds.5019: During Worlds 2015, Mordekaiser was banned 93% of the time. In the matches he was picked, he ended up winning the game
worlds.5046: Since Worlds 2011, there have been 209 hours of League of Legends played at Worlds
worlds.5024: At 690 CS, Sneaky broke the record for most CS in one game as Caitlyn during C9 vs FW 2016
worlds.5032: Who will be the World Champion this year?
worlds.5008: 120 champions have been played at Worlds from 2011-2016
worlds.5042: 43 million unique viewers watched the Finals for Worlds 2016
worlds.5010: There have been 9581 kills across all World Championships
worlds.5020: During Worlds 2015, Gangplank was banned 95% of the time. In the four matches he wasn't banned, he was picked and ended up winning the game
worlds.5035: Faker holds the record for most CS at Worlds with 16306, followed by Pray at 13807
worlds.5034: Piglet and Toyz are tied for the highest overall Worlds KDA on a winning team at 9.73
worlds.5047: The average game length for a Worlds match is 35:23
worlds.5043: The Finals for Worlds 2017 will be held in Beijing on November 4th
worlds.5054: Strength is pushing far beyond expectations, and one of the many attributes of a champion
worlds.5002: Banned 71% of the time, Nidalee was the most banned champion during Worlds 2016
worlds.5040: Karthus holds the record for most deaths in one Worlds match at 12
worlds.5006: Rumble is the most picked top laner across all World Championships
worlds.5048: Worlds 2011 had the shortest average game length at 31:31. Worlds 2016 had the longest average game length at 38:32
worlds.5038: Jensen holds the record for highest average CS per game of any Worlds player at 417
worlds.5012: There have been 9607 deaths across all World Championships
worlds.5041: Since Worlds 2011, the World Championship has been hosted by 10 different countries
worlds.5003: Corki is the most picked bottom lane Marksman across all World Championships
worlds.5033: Faker, Uzi, and imp hold the record for most all-time kills at Worlds at around 200
worlds.5049: 2015 had the shortest Worlds game ever, EDG vs BKT at 20 minutes 21 seconds
worlds.5029: Samsung Galaxy White won the fourth World Championship in Seoul, South Korea in 2014
worlds.5053: Resilience is the ability to experience defeat, and evolve in its wake. It is one of the many attributes of a champion
worlds.5055: Ambition is a relentless drive to succeed, and one of the many attributes of a champion
worlds.5037: Piglet holds the record for highest average kills per game of any Worlds winner at 6.39
worlds.5017: Mordekaiser holds the record for highest KDA ratio across all World Championships at 20.75
worlds.5011: There have been 683361 minions and monsters killed across all World Championships
worlds.5015: Evelynn holds the record for most champion kills in a game during Worlds with 19 kills in one game
worlds.5028: SK telecom T1 won the third World Championship in Los Angeles, California in 2013
worlds.5013: 350 matches have been played across all World Championships
worlds.5018: With 357 killing blows, Lee Sin has the most kills of any champion at Worlds
worlds.5027: Taipei Assassins won the second World Championship in Los Angeles, California in 2012
worlds.5021: Riven, Thresh, Shyvana, Kalista, Zed, and now Ashe have received Championship skins
worlds.5056: 2016 had the most games of any Worlds, at 56
worlds.5000: Selected 129 times, Lee Sin is the most picked champion across all World Championships
worlds.5022: Faker has played in the most Worlds matches at 50, followed by Yellowstar at 48
worlds.5031: SK telecom T1 won the sixth World Championship in Los Angeles, California in 2016
worlds.5007: Picked 54% of the time, Karma was the most picked champion during Worlds 2016
worlds.5036: GorillA holds the record for most all-time Worlds assists at 439
worlds.5052: For those who compete on the Worlds Championship stage, the pursuit of mastery begins with four pillars: Skill, Resilience, Teamwork, and Courage
worlds.5009: There have been 26 executes across all World Championships

vs2018.7013: God-King Darius leads a vicious pack of warriors, hungry for conflict and the glory of proving one's strength.
vs2018.7021: Choosing God-King Garen or Darius locks you into their mission path and rewards.
vs2018.7011: So God-King Darius thirsts for bloodshed, so shall war unfold. His will is indomitable.
vs2018.7005: ''Pledge everlasting fealty to the true God-King, and you shall fear nothing within His empire.'' —Garen 13:14
vs2018.7007: The last remaining threat to God-King Garen's vision for his perfect empire is the forsaken God-King Darius.
vs2018.7006: ''Our faith is our shield, and I am our faith.'' —God-King Garen
vs2018.7008: God-King Garen's divine wrath is boundless. He has wiped great empires from the face of the planet for defying him.
vs2018.7012: The wolf spirit that follows God-King Darius is a manifestation of his untamed might.
vs2018.7020: Complete missions to earn event-exclusive rewards before VS ends July 10, 2018 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
vs2018.7001: So God-King Garen proclaims to all, so shall the law be. His justice is absolute.
vs2018.7023: Complete all VS missions for your chosen God-King to unlock the limited VS 2018 emote.
vs2018.7024: Unlock VS event exclusives, including God-King Garen and Darius loading screen borders, by earning VS tokens through missions.
vs2018.7016: ''My howl heralds war, and death.'' —God-King Darius
vs2018.7026: VS Order and VS Chaos emotes from 2017 return for VS 2018. They'll leave the store permanently on July 10, 2018 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
vs2018.7028: After VS ends, complete one final mission to receive an icon commemorating the victor. If you chose the winning God-King, you'll also earn 1000 Blue Essence.
vs2018.7014: God-King Darius will be consumed by the very war he envisions, and awaits the day his warriors grow strong enough to destroy him.
vs2018.7019: Darius's nameless axe is an artifact from an ancient war, wielded by the God-King to usher in an age of unending brutality.
vs2018.7029: Wolf and Lion Orb bundles, as well as Masterwork and Hextech Chests, include bonus VS tokens until July 10, 2018 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
vs2018.7015: Entire kingdoms have been torn down by God-King Darius's hands. No being is beyond his reach, not even the gods.
vs2018.7004: The God-King of Demacia oversees his people as protector and judge. To his worshippers, there is a small price for peace: their free will.
vs2018.7003: God-King Garen oversees the utopian kingdom known as Demacia. Those who dissent are met with immediate execution.
vs2018.7002: The celestial lion that serves God-King Garen is a manifestation of his ancient power.
vs2018.7017: The last obstacle standing in the way of God-King Darius' vision for a world of endless war is God-King Garen.
vs2018.7025: Power lies wherever war lives. But only one can claim it. Choose your God-King.
vs2018.7009: Garen's Blade of Divine Justice is an artifact from an ancient war, wielded by the God-King to judge the unworthy.
vs2018.7018: God-King Darius believes that a world of kingdoms and empires is a false reality, and beckons a true one indulging the violence in the hearts of men.
vs2018.7022: Until July 10 at 11:59 p.m. PT,. battle in ARURF on a war-torn Rift embellished with tributes to the two God-Kings. All owned champions are playable.
vs2018.7027: Earn Lion and Wolf Orbs during the VS event with VS tokens from completed missions. Orbs unlock skin shards and a chance for bonus drops.
vs2018.7010: ''I'm not a savior. I'm an executioner.'' —God-King Darius

project2017.6000: Destroy Charge Bots and steal their augmentation fragments to Overcharge your team.

y1s3a1.narrative: Xin Zhao has been many things: fisherman, Reckoner, conscript. His true calling was always to be Seneschal of Demacia.

y1s2a1.narrative: The Tale of the Devoted Shrine Maiden reminds us that to bind oneself to another is to share in their fate.

y1s1a2.narrative: Atakhan tore across Runeterra in a frenzy, its newfound freedom giving way to endless hunger. The scent of bloodshed led it to a strange... but familiar place.

ally.djsona: Bring up the scoreboard and click the box next to DJ Sona's portrait to listen in.

cherry.9004: Say goodbye to elixirs. In Arena, we're all about juice! Hope you're thirsty!
cherry.9002: As a youth, Nidalee used blast cones to escape sticky situations
cherry.9007: Coordinating Augments picks with your teammate is key to success!
cherry.9006: Nidalee has been known to make a healing salve from Honeyfruit.
cherry.9005: It's been rumored that Choncc loves dance parties!
cherry.9003: On certain rounds you can choose Augments that provide powerful effects
cherry.9001: If combat goes long the Ring of Fire will begin to close in on the center of the arena.

tip.khelmet: Switch helmet mode on Kai'Sa by typing /toggle (/g) in the chat or pressing Ctrl+5.
tip.aatroxwings: Unfurl banner wings on Aatrox by typing /toggle (/g) in the chat or pressing Ctrl+5.
tip.djsona: Switch tracks on DJ Sona by typing /toggle (/g) in the chat or pressing Ctrl+5.

misc.3000: Jinx's classic splash background is a demolished version of Vi's.
misc.3001: A sushi restaurant in China once offered discounts based on League rank.
misc.3002: It takes 3 hours and 20 minutes to travel from fountain to fountain only using flash (without runes).
